extendedIngredients.name: plum
extendedIngredients.originalString: 1 cup SunSweet Light Plum Smart Juice

recipes.title: Chicken Meatballs in Plum Sauce

winePairing.pairingText: Chicken on the menu? Try pairing with Chardonnay, Pinot Noir, and Sauvignon Blanc. White meat is typically paired with white wine as to not overpower the flavor of the meat, so chardonnay and sauvignon blanc are safe choices. Chicken prepared with a tomato sauce or certainly a red wine sauce can and should be served with a red like a pinot noir. You could try Chehalem INOX Chardonnay. Reviewers quite like it with a 4.1 out of 5 star rating and a price of about 13 dollars per bottle.

productMatches.title: Chehalem INOX Chardonnay
productMatches.description: INOXÂ® takes its name from the abbreviation of the French word for stainless steel, inoxydable. The wine was created differently from most Chardonnay you've had. We think we've succeeded in expressing the crisp, steely, and fruit-rich side that we love about some Old-World Chardonnays. What makes this possible is the use of exclusively Dijon clones, exceptionally well suited to Oregon's cool climate and exhibiting a richness that does not depend on oak. INOX screams of the hallmarks of a cool climate-brightness, pinpoint fruit, and explosive aromas and flavors. We intend INOX for a full range of use, from hot weather chilling to elegant dinner complements.Quintessential INOX, with lovely white aromas of gardenia and other flowers, peach, apricot, pear, pineapple, and green apple candy showing on the nose and palate; it shows a great balance with relatively low alcohol for the year and bright acid; the length is lovely and the weight rich, with a supple, silky texture; flavors linger, with cherry and peach accents. Very pleased.

recipes.instructions: Mix ground chicken with bread crumbs and egg along with garlic, salt and pepper.Form meatballs into two tablespoon size meatballs (I use a medium scoop that is two tablespoon sized)Roll meatballs into panko bread crumbsPlace meatballs on parchment lined baking sheetBake in preheated oven 350 degrees for 20 minutes or until the temperature reaches 165 degrees with a meat thermometer.In Medium saucepan mix Plum Juice, soy sauce, vinegar, cornstarch, sesame oil and crushed red pepper with whisk.Heat on medium heat until the sauce thickens and comes to a slight boil.Dip meatballs into sauce for appetizers.Pour sauce over meatballs and serve over rice or egg noodles for dinner (double sauce recipe for dinner)

steps.step: Mix ground chicken with bread crumbs and egg along with garlic, salt and pepper.Form meatballs into two tablespoon size meatballs (I use a medium scoop that is two tablespoon sized)
Roll meatballs into panko bread crumbs
Place meatballs on parchment lined baking sheet

Bake in preheated oven 350 degrees for 20 minutes or until the temperature reaches 165 degrees with a meat thermometer.In Medium saucepan mix Plum Juice, soy sauce, vinegar, cornstarch, sesame oil and crushed red pepper with whisk.
Heat on medium heat until the sauce thickens and comes to a slight boil.Dip meatballs into sauce for appetizers.
Pour sauce over meatballs and serve over rice or egg noodles for dinner (double sauce recipe for dinner)
